headline: Tracing a meteorite: Niger outraged over sale of a fragment from Mars
description: Discovered in Niger in 2023, the largest Martian meteorite ever found was sold for $5 million in New York in July. Suspecting 'illicit international trafficking,' the West African country has suspended exports of precious stones and meteorites.

headline: Chinese Hollywood races to cash in on the minidramas boom
description: The Hengdian studios are taking advantage of the surge in super short productions, with episodes lasting only a few minutes and designed specifically for viewing on smartphones.

headline: Henri Matisse and his heirs: The end of a financial windfall
description: Since Henri Matisse's death in 1954, four generations of his family have guarded his vast body of work jealously and with the utmost discretion. But when the painter's work entered the public domain in January, it ended the lucrative reproduction rights the heirs had enjoyed, as well as their oversight of everything concerning their ancestor.

description: From a global conference to robotic games inside the National Stadium, Beijing becomes the world capital of robots from August 8 to 17. The event showcases China's extraordinary acceleration in this sector – from automated industrial arms to AI-powered humanoids.

headline: In Angers, working-class restaurants are slowly disappearing
description: Since the Covid-19 pandemic, about 10 establishments that offered full meals at affordable prices have closed across the western French city. Inflation, meal vouchers now usable in supermarkets and the changing lifestyles of young workers have taken their toll on these eateries.

headline: In Serbia, the protest movement has turned violent, triggered by government provocations
description: President Aleksandar Vucic is facing accusations of sending hooligan groups to suppress the anti-corruption movement that has shaken the country for the past nine months.
